          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to watch a game at a pub and hopes that Alexander White and Jacob Walker will be there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)
        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a football game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The Crooked Billet as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends and prefers familiar environments like his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends and prefers familiar environments like his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The Crooked Billet as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.

      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for snacks and stories, and later that night he and his friends plan to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely engage in conversation with his friends and enjoy the pleasant weather.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football games.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for snacks and stories, and later that night he and his friends plan to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends and will be watching the Luxembourg vs. Israel game later tonight.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, picnicking and watching soccer games at pubs, particularly The Princess of Wales. He values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, during these activities.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet.           Answer: William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, specifically Alexander White and Jacob Walker, by picnicking and watching soccer at pubs like The Princess of Wales.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys socializing with friends, specifically Alexander White and Jacob Walker, by picnicking and watching soccer at pubs like The Princess of Wales.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, snuck into The Princess of Wales after closing time. They huddled around a flickering candle, sharing stolen sips of lukewarm beer and whispering stories in the dim light, feeling invincible and free. The thrill of the transgression, the clandestine atmosphere, and the shared laughter cemented their bond, forging a memory that would forever bind them together.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, picnicking and watching soccer games at pubs, particularly The Princess of Wales. He values the company of his friends, especially Alexander White and Jacob Walker, during these activities.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:The staff are knowledgeable about their drinks and always happy to recommend something new.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close circle.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely participate in the conversation and enjoy the company of her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close circle.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely go to the pub that her friends decide on, even if it's not her first choice.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introspective person who values her friendships and enjoys spending time with her close circle.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park and planning to watch a soccer game later.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only decent pub in town. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only decent pub in town. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only decent pub in town. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a verbal bully, their words like blunt shrapnel, tearing down anyone who dares to disagree with their ruthless pronouncements.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introspective person who values the company of close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be joining them later to watch a soccer game at The Princess of Wales pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxing day with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only decent pub in town. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation while watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introspective individual who values the company of close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introspective individual who values the company of close friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation while watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and somewhat introspective person who values the company of close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxing day with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation and enjoy the pleasant atmosphere with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet is usually pretty good for football, maybe we could try there?
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet is usually pretty good for football, maybe we could try there?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales has a great atmosphere for watching games, we should go there.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only place to watch the game. Don't even suggest anywhere else.
      Alice Lewis -- "It's lovely weather for a picnic, isn't it?"
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales sounds good to me.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only decent pub in town. Don't even suggest anywhere else.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet is usually pretty good for football, maybe we could try there?
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The Crooked Billet as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends and prefers familiar environments like his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Alexander White is an introvert who prefers familiar environments and spending time with his close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying a picnic with friends and looking forward to watching a football game later.

          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is an introvert who prefers familiar environments and spending time with his close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying a picnic with friends and looking forward to watching a football game later.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Crooked Billet to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and he wants to ensure everyone has a good time.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet is usually pretty good for football, maybe we could try there?

          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White spent the morning of May 15, 2015, picnicking in Victoria Park with friends and planned to watch a soccer game at The Princess of Wales pub later that evening.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White spent the morning of May 15, 2015, picnicking in Victoria Park with friends and planned to watch a soccer game at The Princess of Wales pub later that evening.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends and prefers familiar environments like his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his close friends and prefers familiar environments like his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only decent pub in town. Don't even suggest anywhere else.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are not as bothered by the presence or absence of Alice Lewis or Jack Taylor.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don't we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales pub.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Crooked Billet

He threw himself into the game with reckless abandon, his raw talent and unwavering enthusiasm making him a standout player. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.', '[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, why don\'t we head to The Princess of Wales to watch the game tonight?', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are not as bothered by the presence or absence of Alice Lewis or Jack Taylor.
        Observation

          Key

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
